# Draft:Edward Dentzel

Edward Dentzel (born August 1, 1970) is an American journalist, filmmaker, actor, author, and missing persons expert. He is best known for creating and hosting [https://theunfoundpodcast.com/ Unfound], a missing persons podcast and video series. Among the nearly 400 cases he has covered, one of the most notable was the disappearance and then murder of Jonelle Matthews, which included an interview with the subsequently convicted killer Steve Pankey. This led to Edward testifying in Pankey's 2021 and 2022 trials.
Early life and education
Edward Dentzel was born on August 1, 1970 in Leechburg, Pennsylvania, USA. After graduating high school in 1993, Ed attended Grove City College, earning a degree in Business. He currently resides in Clearwater Beach, FL.
Ed's interest in disappearances began in the 1970â€™s, with the television show In Search Of, with Leonord Nimoy. Later with the TV show Unsolved Mysteries, and then the internet, technology caught up with his interests and he created the podcast and YouTube channel in 2016.
Career
Podcasting - Ed is widely known as a missing persons expert, covering hundreds of disappearances featured by interviewing friends, family and researchers.
Guest speaker - As a guest lecturer, he has presented on the topic of disappearances to hundreds of criminal justice majors at multiple Florida universities. He has also appeared on several podcasts as an expert. [https://www.deepdivemh370.com/p/the-disappearing-act-with-ed-dentzel-25c ]
Scientific Research and Analysis - Creation of the only missing persons database of its kind using [https://theunfoundpodcast.com/ Unfound]'s disappearances as the data set. This is more in-depth and relevant than NAMUS, and the cases are classified according to criteria that can help investigators and the public better understand the nature of disappearances.
Author - Ed has authored three books on the topic of missing persons cases
